trans-unit.source: Provides design-time visual support for <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> controls.
The WebPartDesigner class provides the visual representation for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls at design time.

It is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.PartDesigner> class and adds validation to verify that the associated control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control or derived type.
WebPartDesigner inherits a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.PartDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property from its parent that is always set to `true`.

This causes the visual design environment to generate a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control to hold a temporary copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> on the design surface; this copy is then persisted into markup.

If you override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.PartDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property to return `false`, the visual design environment generates markup directly from the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control.
Web Parts designers generally act much like regular control designers; the principal methods for setting design-time appearance derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class.
Specifically, you can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to change the design-time markup associated with the control.

You can likewise override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> methods to handle errors and empty strings (""), respectively.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDesigner"></xref> class.
Binds the designer to a control and validates that the control is a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control associated with this designer.
